title: Question 11
prompt: Karl has a driveway that he wants to light. He plans to put in two rows of solar lights, one on the left and one on the right of the driveway. On each side of the driveway, he will have one solar light every three feet. If l is the length of the driveway in feet, what equation shows how many solar lights Karl will need?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
To find the number of lights for the driveway, divide the length of the driveway by 3. That will give the number of lights to have one light every three feet along the driveway. Since Karl wants lights both on the left and on the right of the driveway, multiply the result by two rows of lights.

length divided by three feet, times two rows of lights
(l÷3)×2
